name: Hotel Palatinus

reviews.title: Good Hotel
reviews.text: Located on one of the main walking streets in the centre of Pecs, near most of the sights, this lovely hotel has a beautiful foyer, restaurant and bar. The rooms are adequate and you get what you pay for. When you register this is carefully and delightfully explained to you and you are given the opportunity of upgrading should you wish after seeing one of each type of room. Basically the rooms are the same except the more expensive room has a kettle etc. and air conditioning. In summer it is hot and sticky so if you can afford it an upgrade may be worth the extra cost.

reviews.title: Palatinus Hotel is a Jewel
reviews.text: I recently attended a wedding party held in the Palatinus Hotel on Kiraly U. in Pecs, Hungary. It is a lovingly restored old building in the art noveau style with magnificent Zsolnay porcelain inlay, stained glass, and curvy iron grillwork. The 6 course meal we had was a gourmet's delight of Hungarian specialities, the service impeccable and the gypsy music was very special. We did not stay there, but the room prices are very reasonable, too. It is a real jewel in the wonderful small city of Pecs, Hungary.

I am glad that I chose this hotel. It's a grand-looking place right on the main walking strip in Pecs. The room was small, but that was to be expected. The Internet was free if you sat at a special table in the restaurant.
reviews.title: Good value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I liked having restaurants and bars close by.
reviews.title: great hotel for a low price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night on 23-24 March. The location is ideal, the hotel exterior is lovely and the hotel entrance is opulent. The staff were charming and helpful. Rooms are basic but adequate. Breakfast was much better than expected in a very nice dining hall. Overall I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel.
reviews.title: pity!

reviews.text: As far as Pecs is concerned it's a lovely town worth a visit. There is a lot of construction work going on on the main square, once that's finished it will be an even nicer destination.
reviews.title: good hotel good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a pity that a hotel with so much potential(beautiful lobby + restaurant, ball room, old grandeur and central location) doesn't offer a better standard room, or standard in general.
reviews.title: Fabulous location . . . . once you find it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fantastic 4 nights here. Our room was comfortable, tidy and spotlessly clean, the reception staff couldn't have been more helpful and the location can't be beaten (right in the centre of town). We even had a little balcony overlooking the arcade which leads to the hotel entrance.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was a little bit disappointing - a good selection, but some of the fruit was a little "tired-looking".
reviews.title: Beware of Internet bookings at this Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely use the Palatinus again if returning to Pecs.
reviews.title: Your typical mid range hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last week, I stayed at the Hotel Palatinus for two nights. The hotel itself is not particularly nice or terrible, just very bland. There was construction going on down the hall, the walls are very thin and the beds and furniture are past their prime. On the plus side, the location was excellent, as was the breakfast.
reviews.title: Fine hotel

reviews.text: The biggest problem occurred when I checked in. My traveling companion and I were told that I had booked two single rooms and that a double was not available. With my emailed confirmation in hand, this was clearly not the case. I had prepaid for a "double" US$90.
reviews.title: Pretty Hotel, Well-Located in Pecs

likes.liked: — Top location can't be beat- lovely old building
likes.disliked: — The lovely old building is dated, feels hollow

description: JEWEL OF THE GOLDEN AGE• Situated on the prime shopping street in the historic centre facing the main square of Pecs.• Renovated fin-de-siecle pile with a magnificent lobby.• Stylish restaurant, grand ballroom and imposing entrance hall are Art-Nouveau masterpieces.• Discover why this hotel has long been a favourite among famous guests.
